result.execSummary:
The defendant Connell D Spruill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Connell D Spruill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Connell D Spruill was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Connell D Spruill was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  
*  Pay fine of $100  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:41am-  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 42 months: 18 months initial confinement & 24 months extended supervision w/ conditions on each count concurrent & concurrent to any current sentences.  Credit for 232 days.  DE is eligible for CIP & the Substance Abuse Program.  Court orders a $100.00 fine plus costs, drug surcharge & DNA surcharge on each count.  DE to submit DNA surcharge (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:12am-  State dismisses repeater & school enhancer on counts 1 & 3.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to counts 1 & 3; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 4 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Dirk Jensen.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:14pm-  Discussion held re: motions filed by parties.  Matter remains on the court's trial calendar for 4/27/2015 at 9am.  Bond continued.
